snippet: Dips and rises in reported job growth can come from random statistical noise.
abstract: The Upshot; statistical simulations show that dips and rises in monthly Labor Department jobs reports could theoretically come from mere statistical noise, making it a poor measure of overall economic health; experiment demonstrates that stock traders would do well to put less emphasis on such reports, which have long caused stock market to soar and swoon.

byline.original: By NEIL IRWIN and KEVIN QUEALY

lead_paragraph: Dips and rises in reported job growth can come from random statistical noise.

headline.main: How Not to Be Misled by the Jobs Report
headline.print_headline: How to Avoid Being Misled by the Jobs Report
